sub_topic: Applying the Fourier transform to signal processing
message_1: A signal processing engineer wants to analyze a signal using the Fourier transform. The signal is sampled at a rate of 10 kHz and has a duration of 1 second. The engineer wants to plot the magnitude spectrum of the signal up to a frequency of 5 kHz. What is the frequency resolution of the Fourier transform?
message_2:
To find the frequency resolution of the Fourier transform, we can use the formula:

Frequency Resolution = 1 / Signal Duration

In this case, the signal duration is 1 second. Therefore, the frequency resolution is:

Frequency Resolution = 1 / 1 = 1 Hz

So, the frequency resolution of the Fourier transform is 1 Hz.
